channel.title: theBalancedBriefNLmoneyAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLmoneyAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: My wife and I have $7,000 in pensions, $140,000 cash, plus $3,500 in Social Security. Can we afford to retire?
item.description: “My wife of 20 years is a Japanese national and lives in the U.S. as a permanent resident.”

item.title: Boeing is making a positive turn, says analyst upgrading stock to buy
item.description: Troubled aircraft maker Boeing was given an upgrade by an analyst who said a turnaround effort will get the market to reassess the stock.

item.title: I’ve been a stay-at-home mom for 10 years. Do I take a part-time job to spend more time with my kids or get a job for six figures?
item.description: “So much of my head has been filled with thoughts of needing to be the best, the brightest, the wealthiest.”

item.title: Consumers cut spending on cars and restaurants as tariffs kicked in. Trade wars weigh on economy.
item.description: Americans have become more careful about how much they spend because of tariffs and a slower U.S. economy.
